channel.title: Legacy Life in the Ruins on Roll20
channel.description:
Been playing around with Roll20 to use with Legacy: Life in the ruins and i have to say, i'm pretty damn impressed with the map making tools.
Anybody else used it for map making before?
example below.
![legacy%20map%202|506x500](upload://9UQvjhyoCKi0beIhBkm335E60nS.png)
Each of the assets above will let me drop a banner naming them under them and by double clicking on them i can add notes to them. I suspect this is going to make housekeeping and record keeping so much easier.

item.title: Legacy Life in the Ruins on Roll20
item.dc:creator: @technoskald
item.description:
@technoskald wrote:

Normally in Roll20 you are correct, only the GM can add tokens or assets to the canvas. You could set up a “palette” area to the side and add them there, then give players control of them and let them move things around. Alternatively they can use the drawing tools rather than tokens.
